normalization.p: Only minor normalization where needed, if any, is indicated via markup.

punctuation.p: All punctuation marks in the source text have been retained, and are represented by appropriate Unicode code points.
Punctuation may be marked up with pc elements for clarification, but not exclusively.

quotation.p: All quotation marks have been retained, and are represented by appropriate Unicode code points.

hyphenation.p: Hyphenated words that appear at the end of a line have been retained. The hyphen, if present, is represented by the Unicode code point, and marked up with a pc element. The break="no" attribute on the lb element indicates that a single word is split across the lines.

interpretation.p: Dates, places, and names may be marked up, where useful.

graphic.url: https://mosher.mine.nu/ftm/mosher_other Media/England & Wales, Prerogative Court of Canterbury Wills, 1384-1858(1).jpg

body.head:
T̸ William
Mosyer
body.ab:
In the name of god amen The ffourth day of March Anno ~
dm̃ 1613 And in the yeares of the Raigne of our soveraigne Lord Iames by the grace of God ~
of England ffraunce and Ireland king defendor of the faith &c the Eleaventh And of Scotland the ~
seaven and ffortith, I william Mosyer Citizen and Cooke of London being sick and weake in body
but of good and ꝑfect remembraunce the lords name be therefore praysed doe make and ordeyne this
my present Testament and last will in writinge in manner and forme following (That is to say), ~
ffirst I Com̃end my soule into the handes of Allmightie God Creator of me and of the whole world ~
And vnto Iesus Christ my Redeemer, and vnto the holy Ghost the sanctifier of me and of all the elect
people of God trusting and assuredly beleevinge that by the merritte passion and pretious blood shedding ~
of Iesus Christ my syns art cleerely remitted and ꝑdoned and the mercy and love of God so fully ~ ~
purchased and prepared for me, As that after the Dissolution of these my sinfull Dayes my soule ~
shall enioye eternall blessednes in the kingdome of heaven, My body I Com̃itt to the earth whereof
it is a member willing that the same be buried in Christian buryall at the Discrec̃ion of myne
Executrix hereafter named, And as touching such worldly substance as it hath pleased God to
make me Steward of in this life I Doe dispose of the same as followeth (vĩzt) ffirst my will
and my desire is that all such Debts as I shall owe at the tyme of my decease shalbe first duly paid
and Discharged as myne Executrix hereafter named together wth my funerall expencs, My debts
being paid and my funerall expences beinge discharged I Doe give and bequeath as followeth (vĩzt)
ffirst whereas I at this present tyme Doe stand seised of an estate in ffee simple of and in A house ~
or Tenement at the vicarage gate in Estgreenwch in the Countie of Kent wth thappurte uñces
And of and in six Acres of Marsh land lyinge in twoe ꝑcells in Eastgreenewch aforesaid And
of and in one Acree of land lying next to Mr Lamberts landes in Eastgreenewch aforesaid And
of and in one half Acree lying at the vpper end of Broadfeild in Eastgreenewch aforesaid, wth
said howse and landes are all in the tenure of Mr Pigeon gent or of his Assignee or Assignees
The wch said howse and Seaven Acres and a half of land I Doe wholy give and bequeath vnto
my sonne George Mosyer and to his heires and assigned for ever, Item I Doe give and bequeath
vnto my daughter Anne Rumney Twentie shillings to be paid vnto her wthin convenient ~
tyme after my decease, Item I Doe give and bequeath vnto Symon Rumney her sonne Twen:
tie shillings to be paid to him at his full age of one and Twentie yeares, Item I Doe give ~
and bequeath vnto Suzan Rmney daughter of the said Anne ffortie shillings to be paid to her
At her day of marriage or age of one and Twentie yeares wch shall first happen. Item I Doe ~
give and bequeath vnto the Company of Cooks of the Cittie of London, The som̃e of ffortie ~
shillings to be paid to them at their comynge to my ffunerall yf they shall come to the same and
not otherwise, Item I give will and devise vnto my welbeloved wyfe Dorothy Mosyer, ~
All those my lands and hereditaments wth thappurte uñcs scituate lying and being at Blackbrooke
or Called or knowne by the name of Blackbrooke in the Countie of kent wch I late purchased ~
and bought to me my herres and assignes for ever of one william Erlich. To have and to hold ~
the same vnto the said Dorothy Mosyer her herres and assignes for ever, vppon the Condicõn ~
That if my moveable goods and Chattells will not extend to satisfy my Debts that then ~
my said wife Dorothy Mosyer shall wth asmuch expedacõn and wthin as convenient tyme ~
as may be after my Decease make sale to best advantage of all and every the said lands and ~
hereditaments wth thappurte uñcs, And wth the money thereof proceedinge and com̃inge To ~
pay and discharge all and every such Debt and Debts as I shall Duly owe either by lawe or ~
Conscience at the tyme of my Death. The residue of all and singuler my goods Chattells Debts ~
and Creditts not before given or bequeathed I Doe wholly give and bequeathe vnto my said ~ ~
lovinge wife Dorothy Mosyer whome I Doe make the sole Executrix of this my ^ will , ~
And I Doe hereby renounce all former wills heretofore by me made or Devised. In witnes
whereof I the said william Mosyer haue herevnto putt my hand and seale the daye and yeres
aboue written, Item I give and Devise vnto my said wife Dorothy Mosyer one bay Nagg ~~
towards the payment of my Debts./ The marke of the said Wm Mosyer. This put testament
confey my two theese and one half theese of paper was subscribed sealed and Delivered as the absoꝉo
Deede of him the abouenamed william Mosyer and by him Declared to be his last will and ~ ~
Testament the day and yeares aboue remembred In the presence of Iames Goodyer Snr London
Iohn Mosyer Timothie Mosyer./
body.p:
Probatum fuit testamentum suprascriptum apud London coram venerabili ~
viro Bartholomeo Iseus legum Doctore Surrogato venerabilis vni domini Iohannins Benet ~
militis legum etiam Doctoris Curie prerogative Cantuarienss Mag̃ri Custodis sive Com̃issarij
legitime constituti
Undecimo die mensis Aprilis Anno Domini millesimo sexcentesimo Decimo
quarto Iuramento Dorothie Mosyer Relicte et Executricis in eodem testamento nominãt Cui
com̃issa fuit Administrac̃o bonorum Surium et Creditorum dicti defuncti De bene et fideliter ~ ~
Administrando &c and sancta Dei Evangelia Iurat./ ex /
